subject: Re: [junit] accessing System.out program output from a junit test
msgSnippet: That s very clever, but how do I set it back? i.e. If I have lots of testcases, they all run in the same VM, and once set it seems to be set for every
messageBody:
That's very clever, but how do I set it back? i.e. If I have lots of
testcases, they all run in the same VM, and once set it seems to be set
for every subsequent testcase.

Best Rgds, peter


On Thu, 2004-11-18 at 08:05, Kevin Lawrence wrote:
> ByteArrayOutputStream out = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
> System.setOut(new PrintStream(out));
>
>
> gibbyjohn wrote:
> >
> >
> > Is it possible to compare error messages that a program prints out
> to
> > what I know the error message should be, for a given input, in a
> > junit test? That is, sort of intercept the output from
> > System.out.println and look at it.
> >
